results.title: A Year to Remember 1934
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1934 - King George, Queen Mary and Prince of Wales visit Australia - Locust plague and hunting the ‘pest’ kangaroo - Tasmanian wolf close to extinction - Camels in Adelaide - Louis Bleriot’s first crossing of the English Channel - Charles Ulm disappears between California and Australia - England to Australia air race - Australia wins the Ashes - Peter Pan wins the Melbourne Cup … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: The Water Babies
results.brief_description: When Tom is unfairly blamed for stealing, he escapes by leaping into the water of Dead Man’s Pool. There he and his dog Toby become cartoons in an animated world of fantasy, adventure and songs, befriending the Water Babies and helping to save them from the dreaded Shark and Electric Eel. Starring James Mason, Joan Greenwood and David Tomlinson.

results.title: The Yearling
results.creator_credit: Clarence Brown, Sidney A. Franklin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The Yearling is a story of the Baxter family and their struggle to maintain their small farm. Jody, a twelve year old boy, yearns for a pet with whom he can share the last carefree days of his childhood. He adopts an orphaned fawn but their joyous times are tempered when the fawn grows into a yearling and becomes a threat to the family’s meagre crops. Based on Marjorie Kinnen Rawlings’ acclaimed novel.

results.title: Efftee's Australia
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the documentary output of Australia’s first talkie studio - Frank Thring senior’s Melbourne based Efftee Productions. All of these “shorts” have been transferred directly to video from 35 mm nitrate negatives and prints. Rated: G

results.title: The Sin of Harold Diddlebock
results.brief_description: Harold Lloyd was a born comedian. Depending more on a storyline than many of his slapstick contemporaries, Lloyd was famous for his timid, bespectacled, “nice boy” characters and for thrill-comedy situations, involving dangerous and daring stunt gags. The triumphant climax of “The Freshman” became the opening scene of “The Sin of Harold Diddlebock” in which, 22 years later, the football hero has become a bent, prematurely old clerk, who is about to be pensioned off early. The film is an hilarious chronicle of his reawakening to the joys of life, as he is plunged into a whirlwind of wild and crazy exploits. “The Sin of Harold Diddlebock”, a sound feature and Harold Lloyd’s last film was also issued under the title “Mad Wednesday”.

results.title: Alice in Wonderland
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Ben Sharpsteen, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Animated version of Lewis Carroll’s famous story about the delightful Alice who goes on a dream fantasy adventure where animals are like humans and everything is nonsense. Voices provided by Kathryn Beaumont, Ed Wynn, Richard Haydn and Stirling Holloway.

results.title: Puberty Blues
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Limelight Productions
results.brief_description: A popular coming-of-age story set on Cronulla Beach, where two high school girls, Debbie and Sue, have to navigate the chauvinism and sexism of the popular Greenhills surf gang to find their own selves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Beresford, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Limelight Productions
results.description: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Debbie and Sue are accepted into the Greenhills’ gang, an elite group occupying a particular stretch of Cronulla beach. As surfie groupies Debbie and Sue are required to submit to male whims. Although the girls are proposed as subjects the film maintains a humorously ironic distance from the awfulness of the scene, particularly through the use of narration. The boys, collectively dominant, are individually consigned to the margins. Debbie and Sue are the real mates who ultimately break out of the confines of male-imposed rules. Cast includes: Nell Schofield, Jad Capelja, Geoff Rhoe, Tony Hughes. Based on the book by Cathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey.

results.title: The Best of Britain
results.creator_credit: Moviemaker Film and Television Production Co
results.brief_description: The Best of Britain takes you to nine of Britain’s most beautiful cities and towns. It is a detailed and colourful record of these historic places of interest, which represent a unique heritage and reflect the distinctive ambience which can only be described as the best of Britain. Rated: G
